Sentence 1: During exercise, muscle fatigue occurs for several physiological reasons
Sentence 2: One major cause is the accumulation of lactic acid, which is produced when glucose is broken down without sufficient oxygen

Sentence 1: One major cause is the accumulation of lactic acid, which is produced when glucose is broken down without sufficient oxygen
Sentence 2: This acid can interfere with muscle contraction and lead to decreased performance

Sentence 1: This acid can interfere with muscle contraction and lead to decreased performance
Sentence 2: Another factor is the depletion of muscle glycogen stores, which provide energy for muscle contractions

Sentence 1: Another factor is the depletion of muscle glycogen stores, which provide energy for muscle contractions
Sentence 2: The nervous system also plays a role, as it becomes less efficient at signaling muscles to contract over time

Sentence 1: The nervous system also plays a role, as it becomes less efficient at signaling muscles to contract over time
Sentence 2: This neural fatigue can limit the force and speed of muscle contractions

Sentence 1: This neural fatigue can limit the force and speed of muscle contractions
Sentence 2: Additionally, there is an increase in hydrogen ions, which can lower the pH in muscles and impair their function

Sentence 1: Additionally, there is an increase in hydrogen ions, which can lower the pH in muscles and impair their function
Sentence 2: These factors collectively contribute to the sensation and physiological changes associated with muscle fatigue

Sentence 1: These factors collectively contribute to the sensation and physiological changes associated with muscle fatigue
Sentence 2: Understanding these causes helps in developing strategies to delay or mitigate muscle fatigue during exercise
